intro: Adicea spruceana, commonly known as the spruceleaf adicea, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Adicea spruceana is valued for its ornamental foliage and has limited use in traditional medicine.
